title: Case Exchange API call fails with RegisteredForActualService in JSON body
content:
After sending a REST call to the Case Exchange API with the RegisteredForActualService field in the JSON body, you receive HTTP status 500, and the response shows that the RegisteredForActualService field is different from what you sent.

Meanwhile, a REST call with the RegisteredForActualService.Id field in the JSON body works fine.

Cause

A "Default actual service" is defined in the External System record; however, the service itself has been deleted. When you use the Case Exchange API to create a record, the default actual service defined in the external system configuration has a higher priority than the RegisteredForActualService field in the JSON body. For more information, see Working with external systems.

Solution

Go to the External System record, set the "Default actual service" field to a valid service.
